title: Warren Ellis: Black Summer (Avatar|2007|Dgtl-1920|Zone-Empire)
description:
SLiVer: Story 8/10 (Ellis very near his best); Art 8 (Ryp's style fits flawlessly)
[That's my new thing, for uploads I've actually read. Guess the acronym, win a wish!]

---

Excerpt   (see <a href=" http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black_Summer" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black_Summer</a>  for more details):

 " [T]he set-up:
   
   John Horus, most beloved of [a defunct] team of superhuman streetfighters, has
   killed the President of the United States for arranging an illegal war. He has a 
   plan, and that plan is even more frightening. He has set himself up as the 
   protector of America. And the authorities cannot take the chance that [his former
   teammates] are not involved. The country is now at war with its own heroes.

   In a situation like that, there are no sides. Not any more. It's about who 
   survives and who does not. [...]

   It's about where you draw the line. "

---

Brand-new Digital Hi-Res re-releases by Zone-Empire, compiled into one. Bookended with three full(-ish) sets of variants (plus one original collection cover) and the Ellis essay excerpted above, courtesy of a variety of traditional scans.   Enjoy!
